posts.text: If I had to start as an AI Engineer in 2025, this is the exact plan. 99+ hours of research later! (with timelines & resources) Save it now! 0) Set your base (2â€“3 weeks): Python + DS&A â https://lnkd.in/dmmfnf-z (Udemy) â https://lnkd.in/gwPGw-53 (NeetCode 150) Math + Classic ML â https://lnkd.in/gn9WR-aE (3Blue1Brown) â https://lnkd.in/gAC6iSWN (Andrew Ng ML) â https://lnkd.in/gMMd6Ezu (Hands-On ML) 1) Think in systems, not just models (2â€“3 weeks) Deep Learning fast-track â https://lnkd.in/gs5Wqzj5 (MIT 6.S191) â https://lnkd.in/gYzeJMTc (NN Zero-to-Hero) PyTorch & theory â https://lnkd.in/gN_cUA7h (PyTorch Blitz) â https://lnkd.in/g4xgvu_q (Understanding Deep Learning) MLOps & scaling â https://lnkd.in/g5XGChfH (Full-Stack DL) â https://lnkd.in/gP3UDqwn (Stanford MLSys) â https://lnkd.in/gp-WeZte (AI Engineering Book) 2) Ship RAG the right way (2â€“3 weeks) Videos â https://lnkd.in/gYVF6CfT (What is RAG) â https://lnkd.in/g-953k9V (How to use RAG) â https://lnkd.in/gFXF6DZV (CMU Advanced NLP â€“ RAG) Papers â https://lnkd.in/gW8ee2q6 (RAG) Repos/Courses â https://lnkd.in/g2ZHwZ3w (Advanced RAG) â https://lnkd.in/g4ppP4-H (Awesome RAG) â https://lnkd.in/gKCUaN7G (DL.ai RAG) 3) Learn Agents like an engineer (2â€“3 weeks) Read first â https://lnkd.in/gFvCfbSN (Google Agent WP) â https://lnkd.in/gRWKANS4 (Anthropic guide) â https://lnkd.in/guRfXsFK (OpenAI guide) Watch most popular series: â https://lnkd.in/gN8sv7Q5 â https://lnkd.in/gJt-SQj2 â https://lnkd.in/gk4GKdxa â https://lnkd.in/ghBiVjdF â https://lnkd.in/g_m78sid â https://lnkd.in/gAzBzr3W â https://lnkd.in/g9GR9b9F â https://lnkd.in/gnxRq9n9 Courses â https://lnkd.in/gmTftTXV (HF Agents) â https://lnkd.in/geffcwdq (Anthropic MCP) â https://lnkd.in/g5ytvtH7 (Berkeley Agents) 4) Read what top teams ship (15 min/day) â https://lnkd.in/g7-kjM9K (Google) â https://ai.meta.com/blog/ (Meta) â https://lnkd.in/gWS44qbK (Netflix) â https://lnkd.in/gZn-4NWn (Amazon) â https://lnkd.in/gmvQVn3v (Microsoft) â https://lnkd.in/gyuMHRrE (OpenAI) â https://lnkd.in/gjBHNh2g (Uber) â https://lnkd.in/gX-rAhwS (Databricks) 5) Interviews & portfolio â https://lnkd.in/gwPGw-53 (NeetCode 150) â https://lnkd.in/gzGhDGgq (Stanford CS329S) â https://lnkd.in/gmAg4nBb (System Design Primer) â https://lnkd.in/gx5YF6yJ (DL Interviews) â https://lnkd.in/gzZzMv4k (ML Q&A) â https://lnkd.in/gAKDS4_e (Tech Interview HB) 6) Projects that make recruiters stop â Join "The Mother of AI" project here: https://lnkd.in/dub8tgV9 Weekly cadence â Monâ€“Thu: 60-90m study â†’ 60-90m build â Fri: â€œwhat I shippedâ€ post â Sat: refactor + tests/evals â Sun: 3 blogs + plan Make use of ChatGPT and Coding Assistant to learn and build projects! I hope I didn't miss anything! posts.id: After shipping AI Agents & RAG to productionâ€¦ thes_322
posts.text: After shipping AI Agents & RAG to productionâ€¦ these are the only books you need to cover NLP ğŸ‘‡ NLP (foundations â†’ LLMs): the short stack 1. ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ˜€-ğ—¢ğ—» ğ— ğ—®ğ—°ğ—µğ—¶ğ—»ğ—² ğ—Ÿğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ˜„ğ—¶ğ˜ğ—µ ğ—¦ğ—°ğ—¶ğ—¸ğ—¶ğ˜-ğ—Ÿğ—²ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—», ğ—ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—®ğ˜€ & ğ—§ğ—²ğ—»ğ˜€ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—™ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ˜„ - AurÃ©lien â†’ Core ML that powers NLP: regression, trees, SVMs, NNs. â†’ End-to-end projects; concepts transfer to PyTorch easily. 2. ğ—£ğ˜†ğ˜ğ—µğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¡ğ—®ğ˜ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—Ÿğ—®ğ—»ğ—´ğ˜‚ğ—®ğ—´ğ—² ğ—£ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—¸ğ—¯ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—¸ - Zhenya & Saurabh â†’ Tokenization, n-grams, TF-IDF/BM25, NER, classic embeddings. â†’ Practical recipes with spaCy + Hugging Face. 3. ğ—¡ğ—®ğ˜ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—Ÿğ—®ğ—»ğ—´ğ˜‚ğ—®ğ—´ğ—² ğ—£ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ˜„ğ—¶ğ˜ğ—µ ğ—§ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜€ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—ºğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜€ - Lewis, Leandro, Thomas â†’ BERT â†’ sentence-transformers; real HF workflows (CLS, QA, STS). â†’ Clear view of transformer internals youâ€™ll actually use. 4. ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ˜€-ğ—¢ğ—» ğ—Ÿğ—®ğ—¿ğ—´ğ—² ğ—Ÿğ—®ğ—»ğ—´ğ˜‚ğ—®ğ—´ğ—² ğ— ğ—¼ğ—±ğ—²ğ—¹ğ˜€ - Jay & Maarten â†’ Build a transformer from scratch; prompting, RAG, evals. â†’ Function calling + agent patterns that survive prod. â• Bonus: Build a Large Language Model (From Scratch) - Sebastian â†’ Training/inference nuts-and-bolts; great for serious builders. Make it stick: â†’ After each chapter, ship one tiny artifact: BM25 search â†’ NER API â†’ BERT finetune â†’ RAG endpoint. â†’ Track 4 signals: accuracy, p95 latency, cost/request, failure modes. â†’ Rinse, iterate, demo. Thatâ€™s it. Fewer books. More building. Better NLP. DM me if you want links to them ğŸ˜‡ PS: Credits to Shantanu for the roadmap! â™»ï¸ Save/share if youâ€™re serious about AI Engineering in 2025. â• Follow for production AI/RAG/Agents + career playbooks.

posts.id: AI Agents are not LangChain. AI Agents are not MCP_437
posts.text: AI Agents are not LangChain. AI Agents are not MCP. AI Agents are not â€œjust tools wired together.â€ Youâ€™re not gluing APIs - youâ€™re shipping outcomes. 1ï¸âƒ£ ğ—ªğ—µğ—®ğ˜ ğ—´ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ˜ ğ—¯ğ˜‚ğ—¶ğ—¹ğ—±ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜€ ğ—±ğ—¼ âœ… Start from a real task + SLOs (success %, p95, $/req) âœ… Define tools + guardrails (JSON schemas, least-privilege, sandbox, quotas) âœ… Make it observable (traces, step logs, replays, per-step budgets) âœ… Add determinism (cache, simple rules, idempotent tools, human-in-loop) âœ… Evaluate for real (task success, intervention rate, regression gates) âœ… Tune for prod (routing, batching, timeouts/retries, rate limits, cost caps) âœ… Roll out CC/CD (shadow â†’ suggest â†’ review â†’ auto, with fallbacks) 2ï¸âƒ£ ğ—£ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—± ğ—°ğ—µğ—²ğ—°ğ—¸ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ˜ â€” Feature flag + shadow mode â€” Per-step limits: timeout, budget, retry â€” Tool contracts: JSON schema + validate + PII removal â€” Observability: traces/metrics/logs + alerts on cost/latency/quality â€” Escape hatches: cache/default, human override, rollback 3ï¸âƒ£ ğ—›ğ—¼ğ˜„ ğ˜€ğ˜‚ğ—°ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜€ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—ºğ—²ğ—®ğ˜€ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—± â€” Completes tasks end-to-end, solo â€” Recovers fast when it breaks â€” Small blast radius, tight permissions â€” Real KPI lift (time â†“, revenue â†‘) Bottom line: not a framework choice. Agents are systems that deliver value - safely, reliably, repeatedly. Do you agree with the kart vs car analogy? â™»ï¸ Repost to help other builders ğŸ’š

posts.id: Literally no one tells you this ğŸ‘‡ 99% havenâ€™t ship_303
posts.text: Literally no one tells you this ğŸ‘‡ 99% havenâ€™t shipped RAG to prod. Hereâ€™s how it actually gets built. (Iâ€™ve built RAG + AI Agents in production.) Itâ€™s not just plugging in OpenAI + a vector DB. Save this list ğŸ‘‡ 1ï¸âƒ£ ğ—§ğ—µğ—² ğ—•ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—°ğ˜€ â†’ Whatâ€™s the user problem? â†’ Whatâ€™s the feature weâ€™re enabling? â†’ Do we really need RAG? Rules or IR might work better. 2ï¸âƒ£ ğ——ğ—®ğ˜ğ—® ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—¶ğ˜ â†’ Do we have the right documents? â†’ Are they structured or unstructured? Clean? Complete? â†’ Do we need extraction like HTML parsing or OCR? 3ï¸âƒ£ ğ——ğ—®ğ˜ğ—® ğ—£ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—½ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ â†’ Chunking strategy â†’ fixed, semantic, overlap? â†’ Extract metadata, HTML clean-up, language detection â†’ NER or Classification to filter/query data â†’ Choose between vector retrieval / hybrid / keyword / rule-based 4ï¸âƒ£ ğ—¥ğ—®ğ—½ğ—¶ğ—± ğ—£ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜ğ—¼ğ˜ğ˜†ğ—½ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—¡ğ—¼ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¯ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—¸ â†’ Try embeddings + vector search (OpenAI, BGE, E5) â†’ Store locally (FAISS) or use pgvector for quick validation â†’ Evaluate retrieval manually with queryâ€“chunk pairs â†’ Start small â†’ get 10â€“20 examples right 5ï¸âƒ£ ğ—•ğ˜‚ğ—¶ğ—¹ğ—± ğ—¥ğ—²ğ˜ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—²ğ˜ƒğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—Ÿğ—¼ğ—´ğ—¶ğ—° â†’ Try different similarity techniques (cosine, HNSW, hybrid) â†’ Add business logic to boost or suppress results â†’ Consider cost vs latency vs quality â†’ Use bi-encoders or cross-encoders (re-rankers) if needed â†’ Using custom models? Now you need MLOps too! 6ï¸âƒ£ ğ—Ÿğ—Ÿğ—  ğ—¥ğ—²ğ˜€ğ—½ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜€ğ—² ğ——ğ—²ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—´ğ—» â†’ Pick a model (OpenAI, Claude, Mistral) â†’ Design prompts, add guardrails â†’ Handle hallucinations, cost, and context limits 7ï¸âƒ£ ğ—˜ğ˜ƒğ—®ğ—¹ğ˜‚ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» (ğ—¦ğ˜‚ğ—½ğ—²ğ—¿ ğ—œğ—ºğ—½ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ˜ğ—®ğ—»ğ˜!) â†’ Build Golden dataset â†’ Use RAGAS, LLM-judge, human evals â†’ Metrics: Recall@k, MRR, helpfulness 8ï¸âƒ£ ğ—œğ˜ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» & ğ—˜ğ˜…ğ—½ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» â†’ Try OCR tweaks â†’ breaks chunking? fix again â†’ Change embedding model â†’ update backfill pipeline â†’ Add filters, rerankers, fallback mechanisms 9ï¸âƒ£ ğ—™ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—º ğ—¡ğ—¼ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¯ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—¸ ğ˜ğ—¼ ğ—œğ—»ğ—³ğ—¿ğ—® â†’ Build the data pipeline if needed â†’ Set up Vector DB / SQL DB / hybrid system â†’ Dockerize, CI/CD, push to cloud (ECR, Lambda, ECS, Vertex, etc.) â†’ Add monitoring (token usage, latency, failure rate) â†’ Setup dashboards (Grafana, Prometheus, DataDog, etc.) ğŸ”Ÿ ğ—¥ğ—¼ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜ & ğ—™ğ—²ğ—²ğ—±ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—°ğ—¸ ğ—Ÿğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—½ â†’ Add logs â†’ retrieval candidates + selected context â†’ Enable user feedback logging â†’ AB test against product KPIs (CTR, time-on-task, bounce rate) â†’ Use structured feedback to retrain ranking models ğŸ” ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—»ğ˜‚ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ˜€ ğ—œğ—ºğ—½ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜ƒğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ â†’ Fine-tune embeddings â†’ Use cross-encoders â†’ Add fallback strategies â†’ New OCR? New docs? Repeat pre-processing ğŸ˜… ğŸ§  ğ—•ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜‚ğ˜€ ğ—¥ğ—²ğ—®ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—²ğ˜€ â†’ Requirements will change â†’ Legal/GDPR will knock â†’ Stakeholders want analytics â†’ Youâ€™ll need to explain retrieval logic to non-tech teams â†’ Didnâ€™t even cover LLMOps or Agentic RAG yetâ€¦ The process never ends and thatâ€™s the point. Itâ€™s system design. What would you add (or cut)? â™»ï¸ Repost to save someone months of dead-ends ğŸ’š

posts.id: I did a bachelorâ€™s & masterâ€™sâ€¦ but the truth? Thes_401
posts.text: I did a bachelorâ€™s & masterâ€™sâ€¦ but the truth? These 10 YouTube channels taught me the AI skills than any degree! I didnâ€™t come from CS. I learned it all myself. If thatâ€™s you, start here ğŸ‘‡ I know how valuable these resources could be for someone on the same journey! ğŸ”¹ Foundations & Beyond: 1ï¸âƒ£ StatQuest with Joshua Starmer PhD â†’ Makes scary topics like statistics & ML feel joyful and simple â†’ Start here if math makes you nervous 2ï¸âƒ£ 3Blue1Brown â†’ The most intuitive explanations of linear algebra, calculus, and neural nets â†’ Especially powerful for building visual understanding of complex math 3ï¸âƒ£ sentdex â†’ Massive Python playlist library (ML, NLP, deep learning, and more) â†’ Great if you prefer code-driven, project-based tutorials 4ï¸âƒ£ Stanford Online â†’ Classic university lectures made public â†’ The playlist keeps getting updated with more and more latest content around AI. ğŸ”¹ LLMs & Beyond: 5ï¸âƒ£ Andrej Karpathy â†’ Deep dives on how LLMs and neural networks actually work â†’ His â€œzero-to-heroâ€ coding series is gold for understanding transformers 6ï¸âƒ£ Sebastian Raschka, PhD â†’ Practical, well-explained content on ML, deep learning, and LLMs â†’ Often goes beyond theory into real-world training/debugging insights ğŸ”¹ Hands-on Content 7ï¸âƒ£ Krish Naik â†’ Consistent tutorials on applied ML, deep learning, and real-world deployments â†’ Perfect for job-seekers and early-career practitioners 8ï¸âƒ£ Patrick LÃ¶ber (aka Python Engineer) â†’ Clean, concise Python + ML tutorials â†’ Fast way to build portfolio-ready projects from scratch 9ï¸âƒ£ freeCodeCamp org â†’ Full 10-hour+ courses on ML, Python, data science - for free â†’ Great for anyone who wants deep structure without cost ğŸ”Ÿ Dave Ebbelaar â†’ Focus on MLOps, real-world data workflows, and AI pipelines â†’ Super relevant if you want to learn how production systems actually work Any other youtube channel you would recommend? Comment below and let's help the community ğŸ‘‡ â™»ï¸ Save + Repost to help other ğŸ’š

posts.id: Stop hoarding 17 AI-agent courses. Build with 5, s_141
posts.text: Stop hoarding 17 AI-agent courses. Build with 5, ship 1. If you plan to build & sell agents, start here ğŸ‘‡ ğŸ”¹ ğ—ªğ—µğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜€ ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—ºğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—² 1ï¸âƒ£ Depth beats playlists â†’ you donâ€™t need 17 intros. 2ï¸âƒ£ Systems > snippets â†’ shipping teaches routing, evals, and cost. 3ï¸âƒ£ Numbers win interviews â†’ p95, cost/request, success rate. ğŸ”¹ ğ— ğ˜† ğŸ±-ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—¸ ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—®ğ—¿ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¿ ğ—½ğ—®ğ—°ğ—¸ (ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜ ğŸ­ğŸ³) 1ï¸âƒ£ LangGraph (agents/orchestration) â†’ planning, state, tools, retries â†³ https://lnkd.in/dABmZEyB 2ï¸âƒ£ Prompt engineering (official) â†’ roles, structure, function specs â†³ https://lnkd.in/dQw-x5Yb 3ï¸âƒ£ RAG fundamentals (hybrid search) â†’ BM25 Ã— vectors Ã— fusion â†³ https://lnkd.in/d4Sg_JnE 4ï¸âƒ£ RAG evaluation (Ragas) â†’ faithfulness, answer quality, end-to-end evals â†³ https://lnkd.in/duE-eNrV 5ï¸âƒ£ LLM observability (Langfuse) â†’ traces, costs, latency, feedback loops â†³ https://langfuse.com/docs ğŸ”¹ ğ—¦ğ—µğ—¶ğ—½ ğ—¶ğ˜ (ğ—”ğ—£ğ—œğ˜€ & ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—³ğ—¿ğ—®) 6ï¸âƒ£ FastAPI (async APIs) â†’ type-safe routes, DI, auto-docs â†³ https://lnkd.in/dMmTz_ga 7ï¸âƒ£ Docker (devâ†’prod) â†’ containerize & deploy fast â†³ https://lnkd.in/dkqvfU7K (people often underestimate the power of the original documentations!) ğŸ”¹ ğ—¦ğ˜ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ˜† ğ—¹ğ—¼ğ—¼ğ—½ (ğŸ® ğ˜„ğ—²ğ—²ğ—¸ğ˜€, ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—½ğ—²ğ—®ğ˜) Day 1â€“3 â†’ learn one topic â†’ Day 4â€“7 ship a feature â†’ Day 8â€“10 add tracing/evals â†’ Day 11â€“14 measure & refactor. âœ… Track: p95, cost/request, success %, answer quality. ğŸ”¹ ğ—£ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ˜ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—¼ ğ—°ğ—µğ—²ğ—°ğ—¸ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ˜ â†’ README with a 30-sec arch sketch â†’ Before/after numbers (latency, cost, quality) â†’ Screenshots of traces/evals â†’ One postmortem: what broke, how you fixed it Thats it! Dont overcomplicate! What do you think? Comment below ğŸ‘‡ â™»ï¸ If this resonates, Save + Repost to help other ğŸ’š
